ca.ualberta.cs.w18t11.whoselineisitanyway.model.validator

Class TextValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cs.w18t11.whoselineisitanyway.model.validator.TextValidator

  • public final class TextValidator
extends java.lang.Object

    TextValidator

    Author:
    Lucas Thalen This class contains functions for verifying key types of text input on text fields it outputs error codes, messages, and any found components for the format in question Quick Summary: Phonenumber: +# (###) ###-#### ERR: -1 Indicates incorrect formatting Email: example@example.tld ERR -1 Indicates formatting is incorrect ERR -2 Indicates too many @ symbols in email Currency: ($)#(.##) (with or without $, only needs .## if . used) ERR -1 Incorrect format ERR -2 Decimal without decimal values
    See Also:
    TextValidatorResult

    • Method Detail

      • validateCurrency

        public TextValidatorResult validateCurrency(java.lang.String input,
                                            boolean allowPartialMatching)
        Validate currency string before commiting or casting it to other types
        Parameters:
        input - input string to validate
        allowPartialMatching - True for in-progress eval, false for whole-phrase only.
        Returns:
        Intger errorcode: 1 = All clear -1 = Format issue (invalid chars) -2 = Decimal error (a decimal exists, but no input after; prompt for decimal

      • validateEmail

        public TextValidatorResult validateEmail(java.lang.String input,
                                         boolean allowPartialMatching)
        Validate an email address field to ensure that very basic compliance exists
        Parameters:
        input - The input string to be evaluated
        allowPartialMatching - Turn on for partial (in progress) matching, off for whole-match only
        Returns:
        Integer errorcode: 1 = All clear -1 = Format error (prompt user to enter an email of the correct format) -2 = @ Error, for multiple @ in an email

      • validatePhoneNumber

        public TextValidatorResult validatePhoneNumber(java.lang.String input,
                                               boolean allowPartialMatching)
        Validate a text field for a phone number of format +[#, ##, ###] (###) ###-####
        Parameters:
        input - The string of a phone number to be validated
        allowPartialMatching - False for matching whole strong, true for changing-text validation
        Returns:
        Integer, error code: 1 = All clear; proceed -1 = Format error (Prompt user to enter correct format with example)
